article.headline: Wofford 75, Elon 69
article.story: ELON, N.C. -- Noah Dahlman scored a career-high 37 points as Wofford came back from a 10-point second-half deficit to defeat Elon 75-69 on Saturday night. The senior forward broke the game's ninth tie with a layup and free throw to give the Terriers (4-5, 2-0 Southern Conference) a 69-66 lead. His jumper made it 71-66 with 33 seconds remaining. Dahlman scored the game's first eight points, and Wofford led 36-26 with 3:54 left before halftime, but the Phoenix (2-5, 0-2) closed the half with an 8-0 burst. Elon began the second half with a 15-3 run, getting six points from Drew Spradlin and five from Chris Long to go in front 49-39 at the 13:54 mark. The Phoenix still led by 10, 56-46, after a 3-pointer by Long with 8:34 left. Long finished with 21 points and Spradlin 18 for the Phoenix. Dahlman needs 17 more points to reach the top 10 on Wofford's career scoring list.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
